title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics Boston is tied for second in the Eastern Conference entering Friday.
Brad Stevens has made a few notable trades ahead of the deadline in his five seasons as the Celtics' president of basketball operations.

(Barry Chin/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche January 30, 2026 | 3:58 PM 2 minutes to read There have been multiple reports that have indicated that the Celtics will seek to make a notable addition ahead of the trade deadline, but it might not be for a star player.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants The legislation allows Boston restaurants with beer-and-wine licenses to exchange it for a non-transferable all-alcohol license.
The Boston Licensing Board approved its first batch of applicants to exchange their beer-and-wine licenses for an all-alcohol license.

Barry Chin/Globe Staff Boston’s Licensing Board this week approved the first batch of restaurant and bar applications seeking to transfer their beer and wine licenses for a coveted all-alcohol license.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Local News NOAA confirms the death of a 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale after months of worsening injuries from fishing gear.

Clearwater Marine Aquarium Research Institute A North Atlantic right whale suffering from a prolonged entanglement in fishing gear has been found dead off the coast of North Carolina, according to the National Ocean and Atmospheric Administration.

bullets: Local News The Massachusetts town is planning a one-day name change as New England heads to Super Bowl LX — and hopes its quarterback notices.
